title: Reflexive pronouns
introduction: Do you know how to use reflexive pronouns like myself, yourself or themselves? Test what you know with interactive exercises and read the explanation to help you.
explanation: Reflexive pronouns are words like myself, yourself, himself, herself, itself, ourselves, yourselves and themselves. They refer back to a person or thing.
rules: We can use by + reflexive pronoun to mean alone.
examples: each other)
each person does the action to the other person/people but not to themselves
Do you know how to use reflexive pronouns like myself, yourself or themselves?
Look at these examples to see how reflexive pronouns are used.
Grammar explanation
Reflexive pronouns are words like myself, yourself, himself, herself, itself, ourselves, yourselves and themselves.
I cut myself when I was making dinner last night.
My phone isn't working properly.
Adding emphasis
We can add a reflexive pronoun for emphasis when it's unusual or different.
He wants to pass his driving test so that he can drive himself to work.
She broke her arm, so she couldn't wash herself very easily.
The door was definitely locked.
Are you redecorating your flat yourselves?
Parents themselves need to take more responsibility for their children's learning.
By + reflexive pronoun
We can use by + reflexive pronoun to mean alone.
Do you enjoy being by yourself?
They're buying themselves a new television.
We looked at each other in surprise.
